__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ happened on Cane Run. no PD responded. client was told by driver that someone hit and ran, client was in back and couldn't see outside (shades were down on bus) 

went to ER - was told she had a fracture in her knee

Jewish downtown - was given crutches and a knee brace

502-775-1074 is the number of the bus company - Caal Worldwide limo service

The rental was under a Carla Sitgraves 
__Person Making Contact:__ Justin
__Date & Time__: July 18 2024
episodes.natural_language:
Case: Abby-Sitgraves-MVA-7-13-2024

Initial client contact on July 18, 2024, with Justin regarding Abby Sitgraves and a motor vehicle accident that occurred on Cane Run on July 13, 2024. No police department (PD) responded at the scene. The client was told by the driver that someone hit and ran; Abby was in the back of the vehicle and could not see outside because the shades were down on the bus.

She went to the ER, where she was told she had a fracture in her knee. At Jewish Downtown, she was given crutches and a knee brace. For reference, 502-775-1074 is the number of the bus company, Caal Worldwide limo service. The rental was under Carla Sitgraves.
episodes.author: Filevine Integration

about.relevance: ER treatment provider (knee fracture, crutches, knee brace)

__Abby Sitgraves (DOA: 07/13/2024)__
From: Bryce Koon [bryce@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:bryce@whaleylawfirm.com)
To: [fred1178@gmail.com](mailto:fred1178@gmail.com), [fred@caalimo.com](mailto:fred@caalimo.com)
Cc: [AbbySitgravesMVAZ4665577@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com](mailto:AbbySitgravesMVAZ4665577@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com) Abby Sitgraves - Filevine Project Email Address
Date: Thu, 18 Jul 2024 12:14:08 -0400

Good afternoon Fred,

As you are aware, this office has been retained to represent Ms. Abby
Sitgraves for injuries sustained on July 13, 2024, while an occupant of
your vehicle.

*Please provide me with the information of your insurance carrier,
including Provider, Policy Number, and Contact Name and Phone Number. *

Further, this letter is to formally demand the preservation of certain
evidence related to the above-referenced matter. If you fail to properly
secure and preserve these important pieces of evidence, it may give rise to
the legal presumption that the evidence would have been harmful to your
side of the case. *University Medical Center, Inc. v. Beglin*, 354 S.W.3d
529 (Ky. 2011). *See also*, *Monsanto Company v. Reed*, 950 S.W.2d 811 (Ky.
1997). If you fail to preserve and maintain this evidence, we will seek any
sanctions available under the law. We specifically request that the
following evidence be maintained and preserved, and not be destroyed,
modified, altered, repaired, or changed in any manner, and further that you
immediately put any third-party vendor that has or controls this
information, material, or documentation, on notice to maintain and preserve
without charge:

1. Any and all video surveillance before, during, and after the
above-referenced incident;

2. Any and all incident reports or other similar reports documenting
the above-referenced incident; and,

3. Any other evidence related to the above-referenced incident.

Thank you for your assistance in this regard and I hope to hear from you
soon.

*W. Bryce Koon, Esq.*
The Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Lane
Louisville, KY 40222
Phone: (502) 365-5043
Fax: (502) 237-3207

*This electronic message is intended only for the named recipient. It may
contain attorney-client privileged or otherwise protected information. If
you have received this message or any attachment in error, you are
instructed to contact The Whaley Law Firm and advise in this regard, no
waiver of any privilege shall be applicable, and you are instructed that
you should not use the information contained herein or forward it to any
third person not intended to receive it. *

The Whaley Law Firm has been retained to represent Ms. Sitgraves for injuries she sustained on July 13, 2024, while she was an occupant of another vehicle driven by Fred. On July 18, 2024, at 12:14:08 PM Eastern Time, W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, sent an email from bryce@whaleylawfirm.com to fred1178@gmail.com and fred@caalimo.com, with Abby Sitgraves’ Filevine project email address cc’d.

In the communication, the sender states that his office has been retained to represent Ms. Sitgraves for injuries arising from the July 13, 2024 incident. He formally requests the information of the recipient’s insurance carrier, including the provider, policy number, and the contact name and phone number. The letter also serves as a formal demand for the preservation of certain evidence related to the referenced matter. It warns that failure to properly secure and preserve these items may create a legal presumption that the evidence would have been harmful to the recipient’s side, citing University Medical Center, Inc. v. Beglin, 354 S.W.3d 529 (Ky. 2011), and See also Monsanto Company v. Reed, 950 S.W.2d 811 (Ky. 1997). If the recipient fails to preserve and maintain the evidence, sanctions will be sought under the law. The letter specifically requests that the following evidence be maintained and preserved, not destroyed, modified, altered, repaired, or changed in any manner, and that any third-party vendor with control of this information, material, or documentation be immediately put on notice to preserve without charge:

1. Any and all video surveillance before, during, and after the above-referenced incident;
2. Any and all incident reports or other similar reports documenting the above-referenced incident; and
3. Any other evidence related to the above-referenced incident.

Thank you for your assistance in this regard; the sender hopes to hear back soon. The message is signed, “W. Bryce Koon, Esq.” of The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with the contact numbers Phone: (502) 365-5043 and Fax: (502) 237-3207. The email also includes a confidentiality disclaimer stating that the electronic message is intended only for the named recipient and may contain attorney-client privileged or otherwise protected information. If the message or any attachment was received in error, the recipient is instructed to contact The Whaley Law Firm and inform them of the error, noting that no waiver of privilege is intended or implied, and that the recipient should not use or forward the information to any third person not intended to receive it.

AI Summary:
Reviewing activity in Abby Sitgraves MVA 7/13/2024 between 12/25/2024 and 1/24/2025...

This case involves a multi-vehicle accident with Abby Sitgraves and companions as plaintiffs against Caal Worldwide, Inc. and an unknown driver. The incident appears to be a limo accident, with at least one passenger involved.
The most recent activity is the filing of a complaint and discovery requests on January 8, 2025, moving the case into the litigation phase. (See details)
A potential red flag is that Abby Sitgraves had a prior MVA on July 9, 2023, which was settled for $9,500. This could impact the current case's valuation or credibility. (See details)
The next steps should include perfecting service on the defendants, particularly the unknown driver, and following up on the request for certified medical records from various providers. (See details), (See details)
episodes.natural_language:
This is Case Abby-Sitgraves-MVA-7-13-2024, with client Abby Sitgraves. Reviewing activity in this matter from December 25, 2024, to January 24, 2025, Abby Sitgraves and companions are plaintiffs in a multi-vehicle accident against Caal Worldwide, Inc. and an unknown driver. The incident appears to be a limo accident, with at least one passenger involved.

The most recent action, dated January 8, 2025, was the filing of a complaint along with discovery requests, which moves the case into the litigation phase.

A potential red flag is that Abby Sitgraves had a prior motor vehicle accident on July 9, 2023, which was settled for $9,500. This could impact the current case’s valuation or credibility.

Next steps include perfecting service on the defendants, particularly the unknown driver, and following up on the request for certified medical records from various providers.

The exchanges also include the typical attorney-client privilege notices and contact details from the involved firms.

episodes.natural_language:
This narrative summarizes the email communications in the Abby Sitgraves v. Caal Worldwide et al. matter (Case: Abby-Sitgraves-MVA-7-13-2024; Client: Abby Sitgraves) between Blackburn Domene & Burchett, PLLC, The Whaley Law Firm, and associated colleagues regarding discovery responses and potential motions.

On March 24, 2025, Michelle Singleton, a legal assistant at Blackburn Domene & Burchett, sent counsel a message directing them to use a link to access Caal Worldwide’s answers to discovery in the matter. She noted that the link would expire in 10 days and asked recipients to contact her with any questions. The message was copied to multiple recipients, including Sam Leffert and Bryce Koon, among others, and included the typical confidentiality notice.

Later the same day, at approximately 5:14 PM, Sam Leffert of Blackburn Domene & Burchett emailed Bryce Koon and Michelle Singleton, asking for an update on Plaintiffs’ discovery responses. He stated that if there was no update by April 14, the firm would file a motion to compel.

A week earlier, on March 28, 2025 at 12:46 PM, Bryce Koon of The Whaley Law Firm replied to Sam and Michelle. He said counsel would provide the responses in the coming days and thanked them for their patience. He also noted an issue with the attached photographs: the discovery responses apparently included photographs of the vehicle, but those photographs did not appear on the provided link. He asked whether there were photographs of the vehicle in question and whether the vehicle was still available for inspection. His message included his firm’s contact details and the standard confidentiality notice.

The thread includes earlier exchanges as well. On March 24, 2025 at 4:26 PM, Michelle Singleton asked counsel to use the link provided to access Caal Worldwide’s discovery answers, stating the link would expire in 10 days. She signed the email as the Legal Assistant for Blackburn Domene & Burchett.

On April 4, 2025 at 2:45 PM, Sam Leffert again asked Bryce and Michelle if there was an update on the discovery responses, copying the same recipients and maintaining the confidential-notice language.

On April 8, 2025 at 11:02 AM, Sam sent another message to Bryce Koon and Michelle Singleton (and with copies to others), again asking for an update on Plaintiffs’ discovery responses. He added that if there was no update by April 14, they would file a motion to compel.

Finally, on April 14, 2025 at 8:38 PM UTC, Sam wrote to Bryce: “Bryce – I am following up on the below. If I do not have a response by EOD tomorrow we will plan to file a motion to compel (MTC) to be heard next Monday.” This message closed the thread with Sam reiterating the plan to seek relief if no update was provided by the end of the following day.

Throughout the correspondence, the emails were sent from and to counsel at Blackburn Domene & Burchett and The Whaley Law Firm, with multiple cc’d recipients including filevine project email addresses tied to Abby Sitgraves and Nayram Adadevoh, and included the customary confidentiality notices present in such communications. The underlying issues center on discovery responses from Caal Worldwide, the status of those responses, any missing or non-accessible supporting photographs of the vehicle referenced in the responses, and potential motions to compel if updates were not provided by the stated deadlines.

A case note for Abby Sitgraves concerning her motor vehicle accident dated July 13, 2024, was communicated via email on April 21, 2025. The thread shows communication involving Abby Sitgraves’ matter, with W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, replying to and copying Abby Sitgraves’ Filevine Project email address (AbbySitgravesMVAZ4665577@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com) and forwarding to the recipient rhardwick@erisasubro.com. The message was dated April 21, 2025 at 10:46:29 GMT-04:00 and begins with a simple “Received. Thank you.” from Mr. Koon, whose firm is located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, and whose contact details include a phone number of (502) 365-5043 and a fax number of (502) 237-3207. The electronic message contains standard attorney-client privilege disclaimers indicating it is intended only for the named recipient and instructions in the event of misdelivery.

In the body of the thread, an earlier message (circa 10:45 AM on the same day) from Amy Scott, Paralegal at the Law Office of Bryan B. Davenport, P.C., to Mr. Koon, included the following plan-related information: Plan Name is UofL Health’s OnePlan; Plan Participant and Employee is Abby Sitgraves; Date of Injury is 7/13/2024; Our File No. is K4-1969-25. Ms. Scott attached a claims printout documenting Abby Sitgraves’ subrogation lien, stating that the lien amount is $358.51 as of 4/1/2025. She noted that this may not be the final lien amount and asked Mr. Koon to request an updated final lien amount from their office prior to settlement of the matter. The message closed with an invitation to contact her with any questions, signed Very Truly Yours, Amy Scott/arh, Paralegal for the Law Office of Bryan B. Davenport, P.C. The sender’s contact block listed the firm’s address as 160 Fairway Lakes Dr., Franklin, IN 46131, with office phone (317) 738-9540, fax (317) 738-9310, and an email address listed as mail@erisasubro.com. The “Sent On Behalf of Amy Scott, Paralegal” line reiterated these details and included the following confidentiality notice: the content of the email and any attachments are confidential and may be legally privileged, intended solely for the addressee; if you are not the intended recipient, use, dissemination, distribution, or copying is strictly prohibited, and you should notify the sender immediately and destroy the message.

Overall, the thread documents a subrogation lien for Abby Sitgraves related to her 7/13/2024 injury with a stated lien amount of $358.51 as of 4/1/2025, and it requests an updated final lien amount prior to settlement.

Case: Abby-Sitgraves-MVA-7-13-2024 concerned Abby Sitgraves, with the matter captioned Re: Adadevoh, et al. v. CAAL Worldwide, et al. (Jefferson 25-CI-00133). The communication thread concerns the discovery dispute in that case. The email chain lists The Whaley Law Firm, representing Abby Sitgraves, and Blackburn Domene & Burchett, PLLC, representing the opposing side. The matter involves the underlying motor vehicle accident dated July 13, 2024, and the case caption in Jefferson County (Jefferson 25-CI-00133). The message was titled in reference to Adadevoh v. CAAL Worldwide and related parties, and the distribution included the following recipients: Bryce Cotton of Blackburn Domene & Burchett, with copies to Sam Leffert, AbbySitgravesMVAZ4665577@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com, and NayramAdadevohMVAZ4669798@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com. The email was sent on Friday, May 9, 2025 at 03:05:35 GMT-04:00, from W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with the firm’s phone number listed as (502) 365-5043 and fax as (502) 237-3207. The message concluded with the signature: “I will await your response. Thank you, W. Bryce Koon, Esq.” The message carried the standard attorney-client privilege notice and confidentiality language typical of the firm’s correspondence.

Earlier on the same day, at approximately 2:43 PM, Bryce Koon sent a message to counsel indicating that he had attached correspondence for review and that counsel should please see it. This message included the standard confidentiality notice and a caution that the email was external, advising recipients to exercise care with links or attachments. The attachment referenced in that email was labeled “LT DC re CAAL Discovery.pdf,” suggesting it contained relevant discovery-related material in the CAAL case.

At around 3:03 PM, May 9, 2025, Bryce Cotton, acting as Legal Counsel and Partner for Blackburn Domene & Burchett, replied to the thread. In his response, he criticized the course of conduct, stating: “Are you seriously threatening to seek fees on a simple discovery dispute after ignoring our emails for weeks? What an absolute joke….” His signature block identified him as Legal Counsel, Partner at Blackburn Domene & Burchett, PLLC, with offices at 614 West Main Street, Suite 3000, Louisville, Kentucky 40202. His contact information included a office line (502.584.1600), a direct dial (502.371.0589), a fax number (502.584.9971), and his email address bcotton@bdblawky.com. The message also carried Blackburn Domene & Burchett’s confidentiality notice, the standard “this e-mail contains confidential information” disclaimer, and a separate notice stating that if the message was received in error, the recipient should notify the firm and delete it. The message reiterated that this was an external email, and advised caution when clicking on links or opening attachments.

In summary, on May 9, 2025, a three-part email exchange occurred regarding the CAAL discovery dispute in Adadevoh v. CAAL Worldwide, with the parties’ counsel distributing and replying to the thread. The initial May 2:43 PM message from Bryce Koon instructed counsel to review an attached correspondence; the 3:03 PM reply from Bryce Cotton criticized the predicament and threatened fees in connection with the discovery dispute; and the 3:05 PM follow-up from Bryce Koon reaffirmed that he would await a response. The exchanges included CCs to Sam Leffert and the Abby Sitgraves and Nayram Adadevoh filevine addresses, and referenced an attachment labeled LT DC re CAAL Discovery.pdf, with standard privilege and external-email cautions in the signature blocks.

episodes.original_body:
Case: Abby-Sitgraves-MVA-7-13-2024
Client: Abby Sitgraves

There are other plaintiffs that are going to join in on the lawsuit. They want to proceed against the limousine company. So we're going to have to hold off on resolving the uninsured motorist claim. The attorneys for the other plaintiffs are Bruce Anderson, John Doyle, and Seth Gladstein. And Marshall Rowland is actually going to be the one handling it for Seth.
episodes.natural_language:
Abby Sitgraves is the client in the motor vehicle accident case identified as Abby-Sitgraves-MVA-7-13-2024. There are other plaintiffs who are going to join the lawsuit, and they intend to proceed against the limousine company. Consequently, we will hold off on resolving the uninsured motorist claim.

The attorneys for the other plaintiffs are Bruce Anderson, John Doyle, and Seth Gladstein. Marshall Rowland will be handling the matter for Seth Gladstein.
episodes.author: AaronW

about.relevance: claim being held off pending other plaintiffs
attorney handling matter for Seth Gladstein
